context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: San Jose: Man seriously injured in weekend shooting
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — A man is now expected to survive after he was shot in the city's Alma neighborhood early Sunday, police said. Officers were called at 2:18 a.m. to the 1600 block of La Rossa Circle for reports of a shooting, and found a wounded man, according to San Jose police. He was rushed to the hospital with what were initially deemed to be life-threatening injuries, but his condition has since been upgraded. The victim, who has not been identified, remains in critical condition, police said. No motive or suspect information has been released by police, who continue to investigate the shooting.

context_meta.title: Competing polls send San Jose politicos into frenzy over mayor's race
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — With less than a week left for would-be candidates to jump into the mayor's race, a pair of competing new polls shows Mayor Sam Liccardo still likely to win but with a few wrinkles that has local political watchers buzzing about the outcome of the June primary election.. Liccardo's team commissioned a poll of 400 likely voters that shows two-thirds of those surveyed approve of his performance as mayor, while only a quarter disapprove. More than half of those surveyed also think Liccardo is trustworthy and works well with the City Council. Those numbers make him a shoe-in for reelection, say his backers. “A 67 percent favorable today for any elected official given the current political

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Man Shot In San Jose
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE , CA -- A man was shot at least once early this morning in San Jose, police said Sunday. Around 2:18 a.m., officers responded to a call of a person shot in the 1600 block of La Rossa Circle to find a man with at least one gunshot wound, police said. The man was taken to the hospital with life-threatening injuries, according to police. The shooting is under investigation. No suspects have been identified so far, police said. --Bay City News/Photo via Shutterstock

context_meta.title: Garbage truck driver struck, killed by own truck in San Jose
context_meta.summary: A San Jose garbage truck driver was struck and killed by his own truck Friday morning, police said. At 7:54 a.m., police responded to the scene of a collision at the intersection of Camden Avenue and El Paso Drive. They found a man had been struck by the GreenWaste garbage truck he had been driving that morning. He was pronounced dead at the scene. “Investigators are still trying to determine how the collision occurred,” said. Officer Gina Tepoorten. The name of the driver, who lived in Gustine, has not been released, pending notification of next of kin. The incident marked San Jose's 10th traffic-related death of 2018, Tepoorten said. context_meta.title: Opinion: Diridon Station gives San Jose chance to create urban district of global significance
context_meta.summary: Diridon San Jose Central Station, and the area around it, is the most important real estate and city-building opportunity west of the Mississippi. At this very moment, San Jose has the enviable opportunity to capitalize on the convergence of right place, right time and right partners. If city officials, residents, developers, and employers can align around an ambitious vision, we can create an urban district of global significance. It can be done. In Denver, London, Rotterdam, Hamburg and elsewhere, forlorn station areas have become engines of urban growth, and well-designed development has spurred a renaissance of civic life, identity, activity and green urban living. context_meta.summary: The students organizing the March for Our Lives San Jose rally on March 24 are holding a pre-rally organizing meeting from 1-4 p.m. Saturday, March 3 at the Billy DeFrank LGBT Community Center, 938 The Alameda, San Jose. Students from Saratoga's Prospect High School have setup the framework for the rally to be held at San Jose City Hall at 11 a.m. on the national rally day, March 24. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Pizarro: Sonic Runway's time in San Jose is almost up
context_meta.summary: Sonic Runway, the first art installation in San Jose's Playa to the Paseo partnership with Burning Man, will end its wildly popular four-month run at City Hall on March 9. The closing night will feature a fashion show, with models walking the runway, a trunk show featuring Bay Area designers in the rotunda and a lot of music. Like the Musical Swings that made such a big splash at Plaza de Cesar Chavez a couple of years ago, lots of people have wondered why San Jose can't keep Sonic Runway permanently. As Kerry Adams-Hapner, San Jose's director of cultural affairs told me, the whole idea behind Playa to the Paseo has always been to showcase different art pieces that have the same tech-minded, innovative DNA.

context_meta.summary: A foreign exchange student from Spain who married her much older host in Miami has lashed out at a TV cameraman as she prepares to face charges for allegedly helping her husband abuse her underage sister before his suicide. Marta San Jose, 21, faces felony counts of lewd and lascivious battery on a minor after rejecting a lenient plea deal for first offenders to complete counseling in exchange for dropped charges. The Spaniard, who is free on bail, lashed out at a news cameraman on her way out of court in Miami on Friday, slapping his gear and snapping 'What the f**k' angrily as she pushed past him, the Miami Herald reported. context_meta.title: Google's Growing Empire May Transform Biggest City in Bay Area
context_meta.summary: Far more people sleep in San Jose than work there, a challenge for the California city's tax coffers. Now officials are hoping a massive property sale to Google will change that. Google parent Alphabet Inc., already Silicon Valley's biggest property owner, is negotiating to buy 40 acres of city-owned land for a new campus near San Jose's SAP Center and Diridon train station. It would bring as many as 20,000 jobs over the next 10 to 12 years. Even more important, it would include thousands of residential units — with 15 to 20 percent deemed “affordable” — to a region starved for housing. It's a deal that may transform the San Francisco Bay area's largest city, which has been a cheaper alternative

Here's the response: “Caitlyn Jenner did not attend (the Feb. 28) performance due to production/logistical issues.” Yeah, well, that narrows it down. “Production/logistical” issues could basically be anything. context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: San Jose 12-year-olds suspected in separate school threats amid Bay Area spike
context_meta.summary: Early Friday, San Jose police disclosed that the suspect behind a Twitter post about shooting up schools in the city is a 12-year-old girl. The cases capped a week of violent messages and suspicious social-media postings at Bay Area campuses on edge — like others around the nation — in the wake of the Parkland, Florida, school shooting. “Most are hoaxes, but we don't have the luxury of not getting it right,” said San Jose police Chief Eddie Garcia. Time is also of the essence, as police and schools try to minimize classroom disruption — which is often the aim of these threats, said Greg Woods, a lecturer in justice studies at San Jose State University who was teaching when a scrawled shooting threat surfaced in a campus restroom Wednesday.

"I think last year the goal was said a little too much, 'This is what we want to do,'" Earthquakes right back Nick Lima said last week, according to the San Jose Mercury News.

context_meta.title: San Jose fatal crash: Motorcyclist may have attempted late exit from 101
context_meta.summary: Northbound Highway 101, with the 280/680 interchange lanes to the right. A fatal crash Sunday on Highway 101 in San Jose may have been a result of a motorcyclist attempting to exit the highway too late, a CHP officer said Wednesday. Troy Canada, 44, of Milpitas, was riding his Harley-Davidson motorcycle northbound on Highway 101 at 6:06 p.m. in the far-right lane when he crossed the vegetation area separating his lane from the interchange ramp to Interstate 280 and Interstate 680, according to CHP Officer Ross Lee. Video evidence depicting the license plate of the truck was used to identify Ashour Tarverdi, 59, of San Jose, as a suspect in the case, police said. The appearance is part of the CAST on Tour effort, which is sponsored by CAST Foundation, the nonprofit arm of CAST Centers, which advocates for mental health and wellness. Lovato is reportedly a part owner of CAST Centers.

The New York dance group returns to the Bay Area on Thursday-Saturday, March 1-3, to perform at San Jose State University. Students of the dance program at San Jose State will also join company dancers in the intimate 40-minute dance cycle “In the Shelter of the Fold.” This weekend's performance includes Doug Varone's solo “Nocturne(s),” a work that he began in 1987, set to music by Chopin. context_meta.title: At least eight new routes coming to Mineta San Jose International Airport in 2018
context_meta.summary: At least eight new flights will launch from Mineta San Jose International Airport this year, adding to a 15 percent increase in passengers in 2017 that has made the airport the fastest growing in the nation. Southwest will fly to Spokane, Houston, St. Louis and Orlando, and add a flight to Chicago's Midway Airport. Frontier will add service to Atlanta and Cincinnati, and Delta will go to New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport. Frontier had also announced plans to add a Colorado Springs flight, although that route has been delayed. context_meta.title: Additional murder charges laid in second homicide of 2018
context_meta.summary: Police have charged a second person with first-degree murder after a man was killed on Feb. 18. Police were called to the 1400 block of Pasqua Street around 8:10 p.m. on Feb. 18 after reports that a man had been shot during a robbery. The 41-year-old man, who has been identified as Justin Langan, was taken to hospital where he was pronounced dead. Chad Barre, 31, was arrested later that night and charged in connection to the homicide. Police say further investigation led them to a second suspect, who was arrested in his home on the 400 block of Retallack Street on Feb. 22. Donald Chad Pelletier, 34, has been charged with first-degree murder, armed robbery using a firearm and failure to comply.

It started when Hicks, who owns three houses in San Jose, started worrying about earthquakes. “All that caused me to think about moving,” Hicks said. “Then the sanctuary state came on. That was kind of like a clue.  And then I said okay, I think I need to go.” But he didn't want to leave his longtime tenants, whom he calls his friends, out in the cold. Anthony Duclair had two assists for the Blackhawks. They won their second straight and third in four games following an eight-game losing streak that dropped them to last place in the Central Division. context_meta.title: San Jose: Serial bank robbery suspect arrested
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — A 29-year-old man suspected of robbing three San Jose banks earlier this year is in custody, police said, and its not the first time he's been arrested for the crime. In a news release Friday, police said Oscar Radillo, a resident of San Jose, robbed a Bank of the West at 6213 Santa Teresa Blvd. on Jan. 4, a Bank of the West at 908 Blossom Hill Road on Jan. 5 and a Chase Bank at 555 West Capitol Expressway on Feb. 7. Radillo handed a teller a demand note in each of the robberies, then escaped with an undisclosed amount of money, according to police. San Jose police detectives identified Radillo as a suspect and obtained a warrant for his arrest. On Feb. 13, Milpitas police officers

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Niemi, Canadiens defeat Rangers 3-1 to snap 6-game skid
context_meta.summary: After weeks without a win, the Montreal Canadiens finally found a team they could beat in the struggling New York Rangers. Antti Niemi made 31 saves and the Canadiens topped the Rangers 3-1 on Thursday night to snap their six-game losing streak. Tomas Plekanec, Jeff Petry and Phillip Danault scored for Montreal (23-29-8), which won for the first time since Feb. 4 and avoided matching its longest skid of the season.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Reflecting on Bruce Cassidy's Run In Providence
context_meta.summary: Bruce Cassidy took a winding road in hockey to become the head coach of the Boston Bruins. Since taking over after the firing of Claude Julien last season, Cassidy finished his first 82 games behind the Boston bench an astounding 53-20-9. That's a sample size equivalent to a full season. Boston is in the mix for the Presidents' Trophy and could conceivably finish with a better record than Cassidy's 82-game sample. He started his coaching career in the 1996-97 season, with the ECHL'S Jacksonville Lizard Kings. His career has taken him all over pro and junior leagues in North America, but Cassidy hit his stride in Providence. He never had a losing season in his five with the Providence Bruins.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Spoiler alert: Blackhawks host Sharks
context_meta.summary: The San Jose Sharks will try to avoid two losses in as many nights when they visit the Chicago Blackhawks on Friday night at the United Center. San Jose (33-20-8) is coming off a 7-1 loss on the road against the Nashville Predators on Thursday night. Despite the setback, the Sharks remain in second place in the Western Conference's Pacific Division behind the Vegas Golden Knights.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Managing the International Player Slots on the San Jose Earthquakes roster
context_meta.summary: With their MLS season opener just over a week away, the San Jose Earthquakes are deep into their preseason preparations. The roster, with 26 players under contract and the league maximum of three Designated Players, is almost set ahead of the end-of-the-month deadline requiring teams to be compliant. According to the 2017 MLS roster rules and regulations — which will in some way be modified for this season, though those updates have yet to be published publicly — teams can have up to 30 active players under contract to start the season, so the Quakes still have room to sign any or all of their four 2018 MLS SuperDraft selections: Paul Marie, Danny Musovski, Mohamed Thiaw, and Kevin Partida.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Second San Jose brother, twin, arrested on child porn charges
context_meta.summary: The twin brother of a former Willow Glen Middle School physical education teacher and track coach charged last week with allegedly possessing child pornography has been arrested on the same charge in an unrelated case, according to police. Clinton Pappadakis, a long-time track coach at Oak Grove High School, was booked into Santa Clara County jail on Tuesday. In a news release Thursday, police said Pappadakis, 47, was reported to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children for “suspicious activity” last September. The Alexandria, Virginia-based nonprofit organization provided the information to the Silicon Valley Crimes Against Children Task Force, which opened an investigation.

context_meta.title: San Jose: Man found shot near golf course
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — A man was hospitalized Thursday morning after being found shot near Los Lagos Golf Course. San Jose police officers responded to a report of a person shot in the 2900 block of Tuers Road shortly after 9 a.m., Officer Gina Tepoorten said. They arrived to find a man suffering from at least one gunshot wound. The victim was taken to a hospital with injuries that are not considered life-threatening, Tepoorten said. Additional details about the shooting, including a motive and circumstances, were not immediately available. No suspects have been arrested or identified, Tepoorten added. Anyone with information about the shooting can leave a tip with Silicon Valley Crime Stoppers at 408-947-STOP

context_meta.title: Milpitas police: San Jose pair arrested after stolen car crashes into tree
context_meta.summary: MILPITAS — A man and woman from San Jose were arrested after their short-lived attempt to flee Milpitas police in stolen car ended with a crash into a tree, authorities said. According to police, an officer was patrolling the area of Vegas Avenue when he came across a gold 1997 Honda Accord, and he ran a routine license-plate check on the vehicle. The lookup determined that the Accord was reported stolen in San Jose, so the officer attempted to conduct a traffic stop on the car. But the Accord sped away, police said, and ran through a stop sign at Arizona Avenue and Dixon Road. Moments later, the fleeing driver lost control, hit a street sign then a tree, and the car became inoperable. Two people

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Game nights in Upstate are taking on new meaning at bars, restaurants, breweries and homes
context_meta.summary: Board games sales are on the rise and new ones are being invented every day. The scene is familiar all over the country. Walk into a bar or restaurant at happy hour and people don't always look so, well, happy. Instead, they are looking down at the phones either looking at Facebook, texting a friend (who might actually be right across the table from them) or playing a game.  But that's not usually the scene at the growing number of places offering customers a chance to play a board game. In fact, at those establishments, it's rare you will see a phone out as long as the game is going.  People talk about getting away from the computer to interact face-to-face with others playing games at The Crooked

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: New LA Galaxy goalkeeper David Bingham felt disrespected in San Jose
context_meta.summary: CARSON, Calif. – David Bingham knew his tenure with the San Jose Earthquakes was done last Aug. 12, when Chris Leitch unveiled his starting XI for a game at Houston, and the veteran goalkeeper's name wasn't on it. Bingham had started 91 straight Major League Soccer games for the Quakes, every single one beginning with the 2015 opener, but there were fundamental changes going on within the team and within the club, and it was clear, he thought, that those changes would not include him. Six months later, he's with the archrival LA Galaxy, the unquestioned No. 1 in the nets as the league's most-decorated club looks to rebound from its worst-in-MLS showing last season, and he's having a blast. “I was prepared [for the move to the Galaxy],” Bingham told MLSsoccer.com following Tuesday morning's training session at StubHub Center.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Brewery Adventure: San Jose's Strike Brewing
context_meta.summary: The industrial zone near San Jose State's football stadium is rapidly becoming a mecca for beer lovers, thanks to the presence of Santa Clara Valley Brewing, Hermitage, Strike and more. Strike Brewing Co. began in 2011 as contract brewers, using another brewery's equipment to brew their beer, before opening their current production brewery and tasting room in 2014. Brewmaster Drew Ehrlich and CEO Jenny Lewis' first beers were session beers — lower in alcohol than most craft beers — in a series that included a blonde, brown, porter and a wit, although they've since branched out. Strike's beers are available throughout California, but there's something wonderful about sampling the beer at the source,

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Andersen stops 40 shots as Leafs blank Panthers
context_meta.summary: Frederik Andersen made 40 saves for his career-high fifth shutout of the season as the host Toronto Maple Leafs defeated the Florida Panthers 1-0 on Tuesday night at Air Canada Centre. James van Riemsdyk scored for Toronto as the Leafs improved to 11-2-0 in their past 13 games. Despite the loss, the Panthers -- still in the hunt for a wild-card playoff berth in the Eastern Conference -- closed a successful road trip at 3-2-0.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: San Jose police seeking suspects who rammed patrol vehicle
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — Police are seeking multiple suspects after a patrol vehicle was rammed as an officer was investigating a stolen truck, authorities said. The officer was patrolling near Teatree Court and Thornton Way, off Moorpark Avenue, when around 6:50 p.m. Monday, he looked up the license plate of a Chevrolet Silverado pickup truck in the area, according to San Jose police. That plate search determined that the truck was reported stolen. It appeared that the driver of the truck was aware of the police attention because as it left the area, a white GMC Yukon rammed the officer's vehicle, police said. While the patrol vehicle sustained major front-end damage, the officer escaped injury, police said.

context_meta.title: San Jose Google Project: Group Calls For Transparency
context_meta.summary: SILICON VALLEY, CA — Community leaders in San Jose are calling for the public release of non-disclosure agreements signed by city leaders in relation to a Google project that involves the sale of publicly-owned land.On Friday, the organization Silicon Valley Rising released letters that they and fellow community associations sent to Mayor Sam Liccardo and the San Jose City Council demanding transparency in the agreements they signed with Google that prohibit discussion of aspects of negotiations between the agencies.
